PIONEER EXPERIENCES: A GENERAL QUESTIONNAIRE

A word of explanation to the person answering this questionnaire

It is difficult to prepare a general questionnaire on pioneer life because no individual who is asked to answer it has exactly the same experiences as another. Some of the questions here will not apply to your experiences; others may prove impossible for you to answer, so don't worry about leaving blank spaces. Use extra sheets of paper if there is not sufficient space to answer the questions. Don't hesitate to give details, or describe particular events, if they help to answer the questions.

This questionnaire is intended for persons who lived in Western Canada before 1914, and may be answered by anyone who has personal experience of the pioneer years whether born in this province or not.

If more than one member of the family can answer the questions, they should write them on separate sheets or apply for a separate questionnaire.

Other Questionnaires

Saskatchewan Archives questionnaires which have been prepared or projected are listed below. Please mark the ones you would be willing to answer.

( ) All questionnaires
( ) Pioneer diet
( ) Pioneer schools
( ) Pioneer churches
( ) Pioneer recreation and social life
( ) Pioneer farming experiences
( ) Folklore in Saskatchewan
( ) Pioneer health and housing

Preservation of Questionnaires

All questionnaires will be preserved in the Office of the Saskatchewan Archives at the University of Saskatchewan as part of the permanent record of our Province. Please send your completed questionnaire to:

Saskatchewan Archives Office,
University of Saskatchewan,
Saskatoon, Saskatchewan.

2. Your address ............................................. Tresinistin, Sask., N.W.T.

3. Date ......................................................... Jan. 10, 1880

4. Where were you born? (Give name of place and country) ........................................... I was born here

7. Mention any other places where you lived before coming to Saskatchewan, giving dates wherever possible.

8. How old were you when you first came to Western Canada? (You do not need to answer this question if you would rather not or you may use "I was a small child", "I was in my teens", etc.) ........................................... I was born here

9. What were your reasons for coming West? ................................................................. Born here

10. How did you learn about the West? (Through other people? Reading about it? Railroad or government information?) ................................................................. Well, my father heard about the wonderful north west. So he took his wife and family 7 children and came to Winnipeg by train and then came to the west where he settled down by own self. To work in Timiskaming now. He came out here in 1878, Hornettshead and spent all his life here, he went back East in 1885 and in 1910 for a visit.

4. Where were you born? (Give name of place and country). I was born here ...............................................................
5. What was your father's name and occupation? ...............................................................
6. When did you come to Saskatchewan? (Give month and year). Born here 1880
7. Mention any other places where you lived before coming to Saskatchewan, giving dates wherever possible.
8. How old were you when you first came to Western Canada? You do not need to answer this question if you would rather not or you say "I was a small child", "I was in my teens", etc.
9. What were your reasons for coming here? ...............................................................
10. How did you learn about the West? (Through other people? Reading about it?)

When my father heard about the wonderful north west, he decided to settle there and bring his family. He came to the new land in 1879 and spent all his life there until his death in 1885.
11. What did your friends and relatives think of your decision to come to Western Canada?

They thought it was alright.

12. Did you travel by yourself or with a party (family, friends or other group)?

I went to Ontario with my mother in 1885 because after the R.R. Rebellion and after that we settled down.

13. What means of transportation did you use?

We travelled by an Ox Cart.

14. What incidents of the journey West do you remember? (People you met on the way, meetings with Indians, adventures on the journey, accidents or other excitement, etc.)

When I was 5 years old when we made this trip back to Ontario in 1885, I remember it quite well. We didn't meet any Indians and we got along fine.

15. Where did you first stay when you arrived in Saskatchewan?

When my father came out west he was the first white man south of his family so they were only about two here before him so they were able to stay only until my father's house built for himself to come live at 1888.

16. Where did you settle or take up land?

I always lived with father until I got married sometime.

17. Mention any other places where you have lived since coming to Saskatchewan.

9

18. How did you earn a living before coming to Western Canada? How, after you came?

I always lived here and worked at housekeeping.
11. What did your friends and relatives think of your decision to come to Western Canada?

They thought it was all right.

12. Did you travel by yourself or with a party (family, friends or other groups)?

After we decided to settle in Ontario, we traveled there.

13. What means of transportation did you use?

We traveled by ox cart.

14. What incidents of the journey west do you remember? (People you met on the way, meetings with Indians, adventures on the journey, accidents or other excitement, etc.)

We met many interesting people along the way.

15. Where did you first stay when you arrived in Saskatchewan?

We stayed at a friend's house until we could find work.

16. Where did you settle or take up land?

We settled in Saskatchewan.

17. Mention any other places where you have lived since coming to Saskatchewan.

18. How did you earn a living before coming to Western Canada? How after you came?

Always hard work and worked at farming.
19. How often did you write to relatives or friends in your old home?

I didn't write to them.

20. If you got married, give the name of your husband or wife along with the date and place of marriage.

I got married under Judge J. P. [illegible] April 3rd, 1897.

21. Did anyone else come to Nebraska because of your recommendation as a place to settle?

Sure lots! Family came right after we came.

22. If other members of your family (brothers, sisters, parents, etc.) came here tell when they came and where they settled.

My mother's father came in 1878 and my 2 sisters and brothers. They settled in what we call Nebraska.

23. Is there any particular experience of pioneer days that stands out in your memory which you would like to recount?

I was the North West Rebellion in 1885. I was 6 years old then and I can remember living in the fort. There was a big log structure with a large house next and some tents. They were 5 families living in it. I don't know how many were there.

24. Did you travel about much in the early years? (for business, attending church, visiting friends, etc.) How often? How far? By what means of travel?

We didn't travel around much in early years. We went to church and visited friends near home and to prayer meetings in the town by horse or Open & Dragon.

25. When was the first car used in the community? about 1911.

26. If you owned a car before 1914, when did you buy it? What make? we didn't own a car.

27. Where was your trading center? How far from your home? In Newton, about 8 miles from us.

28. Did you continue to trade there? (Indicate any changes due to new towns appearing, better means of travel, etc.). yes I still trade there.

29. How often did you shop in the early days? whenever you had the money & that wasn't too often.

30. When (if ever) did people in your district first start going to town regularly on Saturdays? they went to town any day they had to.

31. When (if ever) did you first begin to buy through the mail order catalogues? What kind of articles did you buy in this way? Indicate also what fraction of your total purchases were by mail order and any changes in the proportion of purchases made by mail order since the pioneer period.

32. When did you first have a telephone and what company provided it? 1918, and Bell's company provided it.

33. When you came to Saskatchewan the first time was it with the idea of staying permanently? Or did you make up your mind after trying it out? When did you make this decision? yes we liked it here so we stayed.
